title: Effects of an inhibitor of glycolysis set member 3

content.question: An increase in the concentration of protons in the cytosol will most likely have which of the following effects on glycolysis?

choices.label: Glycolytic enzymes will denature as a result of the increased <math alttext="H with a plus one charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>concentration.

Reaction rate will increase as a result of the increased <math alttext="H with a plus one charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>concentration.

<math alttext="H with a plus one charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> will replace phosphorous and inhibit <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> formation from <math alttext="A D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ADP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The water potential will increase, resulting in a decrease in the rate of glycolysis.

content.answer: Glycolytic enzymes will denature as a result of the increased <math alttext="H with a plus one charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>concentration.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
